rComments: Want to learn about electronic music (not necessarily EDM) but definitely wanted to obtain knowledge of modern electronic music. We mainly learned about old instruments and listened to songs made by past experimental electronic music artists. Not the class I was looking for. We had interesting guests, Larry is very accomplish, & it's an easy GE.

literally the easiest class I have ever taken. I don't think it was possible to fail. The material was really boring (avant-garde noise and pretentious "electronic" drivel) but Larry's sense of humour and style of teaching made me look forward to every class. IF you attend every lecture you'll get an A. It's that simple.

Larry uses unnecessarily long words and I question whether he understands them or not. He loves to play loud, damaging sounds because it pains his students. He tends to pause frequently when he speaks, helping you fall asleep. Homework and assignments revolve around specific facts that are otherwise irrelevant. Larry is a nice man. That's it.
Rude professor. Lecturers were amazing. Honestly I loved the guest speakers that were there. Other than that he is not clear on his assignments. Final paper is not clear.
